item.title: ガーディアンがギャンブル広告の世界的禁止を発表、依存症につながるサービスからお金を取るのは倫理に反すると主張（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
The Guardian announces a global ban on gambling advertising, arguing that taking money from services that can lead to addiction is unethical  —  Ban will apply worldwide to all of media group's online and print outlets, including the Guardian, Observer, and Guardian Weekly

item.title: 英国政府、クリエイティブ産業の支援に7700万ポンドを拠出、うち5000万ポンドは映画製作やビデオゲーム開発を促進する「クリエイティブ・クラスター」を育成（Daniel Thomas/Financial Timesより引用）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
The UK government commits £77M to supporting creative industries, including £50M to grow “creative clusters” to boost film production and video game development  —  Jeremy Hunt says money will boost sector's economic value by £50bn and add 1mn jobs

item.title: Google、EU著作権指令に基づき15カ国1,500以上の出版物と合意、その他ジャーナリズムとの提携に関する最新情報を共有（Sulina Connal/The Keyword)
item.description:
Sulina Connal / The Keyword:
Google reaches agreements with over 1,500 publications in 15 countries under the EU Copyright Directive and shares other updates on its journalism partnerships  —  Managing Director, News and Publishing Partnerships  —  Today I am pleased to provide an update on our progress …

item.title: ニュージーランドでは、大人気の海賊版サイト「Megaupload」を運営していた2人の男性に2年以上の懲役を科し、11年にわたる身柄引き渡し合戦に終止符を打った（Nick Perry/Associated Press）。
item.description:
Nick Perry / Associated Press:
New Zealand sentences two men who ran the wildly popular pirating website Megaupload to more than two years in prison, ending an 11-year extradition battle  —  Two men who helped run the once wildly popular pirating website Megaupload were each sentenced by a New Zealand court on Thursday to more than two years in prison.

item.title: ハフポストのシニアエディターであるフィリップ・ルイス氏に、Twitterがジャーナリズムのキャリアをスタートさせるのに役立った経緯や、現在Twitterやその他のプラットフォームをどのように使っているかについてのインタビュー（Karla Rodriguez/Complex)
item.description:
Karla Rodriguez / Complex:
An interview with Philip Lewis, a HuffPost senior editor, on how Twitter helped him launch his journalism career and how he uses Twitter and other platforms now  —  The journalist talks to Complex about using his social media virality to serve others during a time when media literacy is needed.

item.title: チャレンジャー、グレイ＆クリスマス：メディア部門は2023年に少なくとも17,436人の人員削減を発表し、2020年の5月までの16,750人を上回り、前年比最高水準となった（Sara Fischer/Axios)
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Challenger, Gray & Christmas: the media sector announced at least 17,436 job cuts so far in 2023, the highest YTD level, surpassing 16,750 cuts till May in 2020  —  The media industry has announced at least 17,436 job cuts so far this year, marking the highest year-to-date level of cuts on record …

item.title: オーストラリアのABCは、政治編集者のアンドリュー・プロビンを余剰人員とし、7月1日の大規模な再編を前に、最大で100人の人員削減を行う（Amanda Meade/The Guardian）
item.description:
Amanda Meade / The Guardian:
Australia's ABC makes political editor Andrew Probyn redundant, one of the up to 100 job cuts at the broadcaster before a major restructure kicks in on July 1  —  Probyn said he was told by the ABC they ‘no longer need a political editor and they want to reinvest the money into social and digital reporting roles’

item.title: サイモン＆シュスター、アルフレッド・A・ノップフ、ニューヨーカーの元編集長で、ジョセフ・ヘラー、トニ・モリスンなどを編集したロバート・ゴットリーブが92歳で死去（Robert D. McFadden/New York Times）。
item.description:
Robert D. McFadden / New York Times:
Robert Gottlieb, former editor-in-chief of Simon & Schuster, Alfred A. Knopf, and The New Yorker, who edited Joseph Heller, Toni Morrison, and more, dies at 92  —  At Simon & Schuster, Alfred A. Knopf and The New Yorker, he polished the work of a who's who of mid-to-late 20th century writers.

item.title: The Onion Unionによると、G/O MediaのCEOであるJim Spanfellerは、Onion Unionのメンバー4人を含む13人の従業員を解雇し、組合に相談しなかった経営陣を非難しています (@onionincunion)
item.description:
@onionincunion:
The Onion Union says G/O Media CEO Jim Spanfeller laid off 13 employees, including four Onion Union members, and blasts management for not consulting the union  —  Our statement on today's layoffs: [image]

item.title: 今は基本的に死んでしまったGimlet Mediaを振り返り、Gimletがどんな犠牲を払っても利益を追い求めざるを得なかったポッドキャストのためのベンチャーキャピタルゴールドラッシュ（Alex Sujong Laughlin/Defector)
item.description:
Alex Sujong Laughlin / Defector:
A look back at Gimlet Media, now basically dead, and the venture capital gold rush for podcasts that forced Gimlet to chase profit at any cost  —  Gimlet Media is basically dead.  —  Last week, Spotify announced it was laying off 200 workers and combining Gimlet and Parcast into one original podcast studio within the company.

item.title: 13日間にわたるInsiderのストライキが終了、労使間で最低賃金を年額65Kドルに引き上げ、2023年のレイオフを行わないという誓約を含む合意に達した（Washington Post）。
item.description:
Washington Post:
The 13-day Insider strike ends, as its union and management reach a deal that boosts the pay minimum to $65K/year and includes a pledge for no more 2023 layoffs  —  The 13-day labor struggle prompted managers to write their own stories and the editor in chief to tear down union fliers.

item.title: 米国立音楽出版社協会がツイッターを提訴、同社が〜1700曲を無断使用し作詞家の著作権を侵害していると主張（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
The US National Music Publishers' Association sues Twitter, alleging the company violates the copyright of songwriters by using ~1,700 songs without permission  —  The National Music Publishers' Association sued Twitter Inc. Wednesday, alleging it violates the copyright of songwriters by using …

item.title: Gannettは、コロラド州のThe Pueblo Chieftainの印刷をDenverに移す予定で、51人の従業員が影響を受け、Chieftainの建物を市場に出している（Jaleesia Fobbs/KRDO）。
item.description:
Jaleesia Fobbs / KRDO:
Gannett plans to move printing of The Pueblo Chieftain in Colorado to Denver, affecting ~51 employees, and is putting the Chieftain's building on the market  —  PUEBLO, Colo. (KRDO)—A recent press release statement by the Pueblo News Guild is announcing that Gannett, the corporate owner …

item.title: Bell Mediaの親会社は、1,300人の雇用削減と9つのラジオ局の閉鎖または売却を計画。EVP Robert Malcolmsonは、法案C-18と法案C-11を巡るプロセスを嘆く（Sammy Hudes/Canadian Press）。
item.description:
Sammy Hudes / Canadian Press:
Bell Media's parent plans to cut 1,300 jobs and close or sell nine radio stations; EVP Robert Malcolmson lamented the process around Bill C-18 and Bill C-11  —  Bell Canada Enterprises Inc. (BCE Inc.) is cutting 1,300 positions, around three per cent of its workforce, and closing …

item.title: フォックスニュースのサイロンがバイデンを「政敵を逮捕させている」「独裁者志望」と呼んだ後、フォックスはすぐに削除して対処したと発表（Charlotte Klein/Vanity Fair）。
item.description:
Charlotte Klein / Vanity Fair:
After a Fox News chyron called Biden a “wannabe dictator” who is “having his political rival arrested”, Fox says it was taken down immediately and addressed  —  “There is a cost to us as a news organization to knowingly broadcast untrue things,” Rachel Maddow told MSNBC viewers.
